Posts.Content: djandkmommy wrote: Hi Ladies - I hope you can help clear some things up for me.  A little background - I'm almost 38 and have no history of bc in my family.  I also breastfed all three of my children.   I went for a baseline mammogram about 4 weeks ago and received a call back for more scans on my left breast.    When I went to the call back the technician (not a doctor) showed me the original scans and said that my left breast has more dense tissue than my right and they wanted to look more closely.   All I could see was what looked like an xray with a white mass in the middle.   Well, the radiologist left me a voice mail last night and said I needed to come back but gave me no more information.   I made an appointment for an u/s (not for 2 weeks) but never got a clear answer on what the concerns were.    Does anyone have any experience with anything similar?   I'm very stressed and have two weeks to wait so I'm hoping for some insight. Thanks so much! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Have Some Questions djandkmommy Beesie
